Reviews.Title: “Clean but very Basic”
Reviews.Author: Ronald K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic. The room and breakfast are not 3 stars. But the people who works are very helpfull. The hotel is nearby the center and termin. When you want to book this hotel you book it when you get a discount price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Equilino”
Reviews.Author: varangkanar p Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Weird hotel and quite difficult to find the hotel. The service was perfect but no connection even the advertisement showed WIFI and dirty toilet. And the hotel made me feel not save that using emergency door which i could not lock the door from inside. The room was too cold and made me sick.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Frequentcitybreaker
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget 2 night break so were not expecting the world however the 3 star rating was a bit optimistic! The room was an adequate size, the beds comfortable, and the showers hot which was all that was required as we were out sightseeing all day. The location was great, with all major sights a managable walk or short bus journey away. Francesco, who was on reception in the evenings, spoke perfect English (albeit with an American accent) and was very friendly and informative. The negatives: More attention could have been paid to cleanliness and maintenance. Bathrooms were a bit cramped. Breakfast was a bit ordinary, 1 large croissant followed by as much bread, butter and jam as you wanted, and tea, coffee or juice. Our room was above a busy street which was very noisy however, our companions had an inner room which was fine. All in all the hotel was quite basic and would be suitable for backpackers on a budget, but if you're after a romantic break and a touch of luxury... steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “All right if you're not staying in the room for much time”
Reviews.Author: Nourrie
Reviews.Content: The room, bedding and facilities were clean but the TV did not work and the fridge only operated when the room key was in its holder - no cold drinks except in the morning! The dining room is only big enough for about a third of the guests at one time. However the staff are friendly and helpful. It is very convenient for the bus and train stations and close enough to most of the tourist attractions to reach by foot (in comfortable walking shoes) and there are plenty of reasonably priced cafes and restaurants nearby. Finding it is not straightforward: it is on the south side of the Esquilino Piazza through a door to private apartments as well as the hotel. Then into a dingy courtyard and to the right up one floor to reception. (At night you have to buzz the intercom in the street.) We only stayed a few days and had good weather, doing little more than sleeping and washing in the room, which was above a busy street. Not recommended for long stays. A note about travelling from Fiumicino Airport to the centre: shuttle buses (8Euros one way) go every 20 minutes and take about 1hour 10minutes, the train (15Euros) is every half hour and takes around forty minutes and is only called an express because it doesn't stop at any intervening stations!

Reviews.Title: “If you can find it........”
Reviews.Author: Kieran J
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the hotel. Having searched for the entrance, I eventually noticed the small sign and entered through a shared, dirty, smelly corridor. After checking in I negotiated my way past the bicycles, suitcases and paint tins in the corridor to get to my room. Among other things, the 20-year old television didn't work, the bathroom light was broken, the air-conditioning was set at 22 degrees and couldn't be changed and there was no chair in the room (I didn't even ask about Internet). It was convenient to the station and my meeting place, but if I was staying more than one night I would definately have moved to a different place to stay. Although it is called a hotel and charges hotel prices (it cost me 113 euro), it is no more than a 'stopping place'. The location and reported (in other reviews) friendly staff in no way make up for the poor quality room and breakfast in this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: alicia-jessie
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at Hotel Esquilino for 2 nights. We had received a confirmed booking for 3 nights, however we were forced to stay in a 1 star hotel (Hotel Tizi) on the other side of Rome after arriving to find that the hotel was in fact full for our first night - despite the booking. No offer to help us get there, and the man at reception was very rude. We also had to use other guests to translate as he spoke absolutely no english at all. Not a good first impression. Positive comments: - good location, assuming you actually are able to stay at this hotel for all nights booked. - decent continental breakfast, although you will most likely have to wait for space in the breakfast room, and the man at reception will pace the room looking frustrated until you leave to make room for waiting guests. - shower was large and always warm. Negative comments: - hard to find as you need to enter courtyard before you reach main entrance. - very rude and unhelpful staff, besides the man who was there on our last day - he spoke some english and seemed polite. - no air con, which would be fine if a fan was provided but also no fan, made worse by the fact that the window opened on to the inner courtyard so there was no breeze, very hot nights. - the minibar that was advertised was in the room, but unplugged and dusty so virtually unusable. - the beds were held together with masking tape. - the door handle to the bathroom was broken. - we asked 3 staff members on seperate occassions for the internet password, and were given 3 different answers - none of which worked. - room not cleaned on the 2nd day, only fresh towels were left in the entry. - based on previous reviews about suspected staff theft, we locked up our personal items during day and night, but felt uneasy for the entire stay based on the nature of the staff, although thankfully nothing was stolen. - when we asked about compensation for the inconvenience the hotel had caused, we were rudely refused and told that they would not budge on price. I would advise you to spend a little more money and stay somewhere decent. We thought that its great location would make up for any negative aspects, but we were extremely disappointed. We will not be returning to Hotel Esquilino.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL IN EUROPE”
Reviews.Author: valerievandyck
Reviews.Content: If people try to warn you with complains your should listen. This IS THE NASTIEST AND DIRTIEST HOTEL I EVER KNOW. We stayed there 1day what we didnt want but we had to because our travel agent was closed in our country. SO this night was terrible. I would stay more likely on the streets then in this ugly and dirty hotel!!!!!!!!! Here is a list of SOME wrong things: - The Bathrooms are dirty with mold -The cranes are mold and broken. Water spray all over the place -The sink was yellow of dirt The toilet made huge noise the hole entire time -Stains and holes at the wall -NO AIRCO -TELEVISION BROKEN -MINI BAR WITH NOOOO DRINKS AND WARM / NO PLUG IN -THE SERVICE IS RUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! No MANNERS AT ALL -The rooms windows didnt close it was broken! All the noise in the room -The door didnt locked on the inside These are SOME points but the list is toooooooooo long. If you want to stay here, its up to you. But I now learned to take reviews from people serious. THIS HOTELLLLLLLLL IS BADDDDDDDDDDD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NEVERRRRRR STAY HERE GHETTO PLACE AND FOR THE PEOPE LIKE ME THAT DIDNT KNOW you have to pay every day 2 euro and in expensive hotels 3 euro a day FOR THE CITYTAX EVERYBODY

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Romaica
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, it's on a main street and close to the main bus stations and Termini railway station, which is great. There are stores and restaurants in the streets around it. It's a bit of a walk from Piazza Republica. The staff, or the only man we saw there, didn't speak English and it was not easy trying to communicate, my friend, who knew some Spanish, talked to him and we figured out the rest. We were charged 10 Euros per room a night for the air condition. I don't know , is that normal in Rome? Not to mention the city tax 2 Euros per person a night. The food was very basic, nothing fancy at all. We had a problem with the electricity which kept coming and going. And the tv wasn't working and we asked the receptionist to fix the sink It looked more like a two star hotel to me. Honestly I wouldn't stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Effie2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed there three nights as part of a budget package deal. First impressions of the hotel weren't great. Old, generally 'tired' look. The clerk at the desk who I had read about in one review was indeed friendly and helpful with recommendations for tourist destinations and markets. He also helped to make a call for enquiries for concert tickets! By the second day I could certainly appreciate the location. Easy to find your way to the Termini station; easy to walk to the Via Nationale and other major streets where you can get buses. I would recommend getting the Roma pass if you're staying there three days. If you use the buses, metro, museum and attend cultural events in the same period, you definitely even out the cost. Breakfast is very simple. Rooms are cleaned daily, (but it wasn't squeaky clean to start off with). They close the main door at 7 p.m. but if you're out till later, all you have to do is ring the bell to get in. All in all, charming enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, really good hotel to stay with a group of students”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMargareta
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel with really friendly and helpful staff (After reading other reviews I was a bit worried but the staff was excellent!) Located near both the Termini Station, Colosseum, Fontana di Trevi and Spanish Steps - in the middle of everything and "next door neighbour" with the beautiful church Santa Maria Maggiore. Busy street with a lot of traffic, though nice neighbourhood with many good restaurants with decent prices. It's not a hotel where you enjoy staying in your room all day, and I would'n choose it for a romantic getaway - but if you look for a simple accomodation and if you travel with a group of teachers&students which we did, it's perfect. I'd advice you to bring your own towels, the ones in the hotel are really thin and although they were properly washed they still had stains. Breakfast is ok but the breakfast room is small so you may have to wait for your turn. A big plus for the freshly made coffee!! Don't book directly through the hotel, then it's really expensive. We used hotelpronto.com and got a great offer! By the way there's no internet in the hotel, but just around the corner there's an internet place where you pay 50 cent/15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and Overprised”
Reviews.Author: dexter60811
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to colesseum. major metro station just 2 minutes walk away. Rooms were very old and neglected.. Breakfast was below average..

Reviews.Title: “top place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: nicDavos
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very well located 5 min from the main train station so very easy to reach from the airport with public transportation.bus station of all important city busses very close. hotel room are nice and freshly renovated,very good price.if you like to sleep with open windows take ear protections with you because traffic in rome is very lound night and day.very good place to stay as a couple or with family or allone to dicover the city.

Reviews.Title: “So bad it almost ruined my Rome experience”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Hated this hotel. I like to consider myself a reflective reviewer - a consultation of my other contributions hopefully emphasizes this, but this hotel really riled me up. For starters it is run by an owner-occupier who clearly doesn't believe in delegation or is too parsimonious to emply staff. He watches over everyone and everything with a zeal that makes you uncomfortable. Insists on a midnight curfew which is outrageous - one night we were at the other side of the city in and had to leave an enjoyable piazza with evening entertainment just to ensure we wouldn't have to ring the bell and endure a tongue-lashing from him. The room is shockingly austere. Italian hotels pride themselves on authenticity and quirky quainteness but this room was so dusty, musty and unrefined it was untrue. Bring anti-histamines and inhalors if you're prone to respiratory problems. The 'bathrooms' were obviously added recently, ridiculous pre-fabricated cublicles wedged in the corner of the room. The walls stop at about 9ft meaning it's essentially like the cubicle in a public toilet. The window shutters were a poor design meaning interrupted sleep with noise from the courtyard below. Breakfast was mediocre. The location is very goof, I'll concede - in the shadow of the Santa Maria Maggiore church, steps from Termini rail station and an easy stroll to the Colosseum. But there are plenty of other hotels in this neighbourhood, do you really want to clamber in a 'door in a gate' (yes that's the entrance - think mechanic's yard!) to access your hotel? Avoid avoid! But Rome is a beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, so-so accommodation”
Reviews.Author: stasybg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for the budget traveller - ideally located to most sites, Roma Termini (central station of the metro and the train to Fiumicino airport) and nice local trattorias. The rooms are nothing to write home about, but bathrooms are nice if small. they only serve breakfast and a token continental one at that, but who cares. I was there for the sightseeing and only returned to sleep. To me, it was the perfect venue

Reviews.Title: “hotel esquilino review”
Reviews.Author: DanielT4
Reviews.Content: the hotel is about average, its really close to the main train/bus station "termini station" its also right down the main street from the colosseum and all the other main attractions. the rooms are nice just a bit old, the service is great and the hotel staff are very polite and helpful! it also goes for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “I suggest a cousy hotel for young people”
Reviews.Author: mikyfp
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for a weekend for me and my boyfriend. The hotel is recently rennovated in an ancient building. I wrote an email that it was the birthday of my boyfriend... and we found a bottle of spumante in our room! they didn't charge anything. The frigobar was empty, we asked way and they answered that it was a service for clients to put their bottles inside without paying the electricity... every thing seemed to be so simple...

Reviews.Title: “right place for location wrong hotel”
Reviews.Author: susaneLs28
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very scruffy light bulbs in rooms without shades. No curtains at windows. Wallpaper in the rooms were falling off. In the bathrooms the shelf was not straight couldn't put anything on it. The shower had to be held as nothing to fix it to. We asked for glasses for the room but they never appeared. We asked if we could use the fridge that was in the room but they never unlocked it so we had to have warm water during the night. Never found the safe which was supposed to be in the room couldn't find it.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated and shabby”
Reviews.Author: BangkokTingtong
Reviews.Content: Arrived by taxi and couldn't see the place, you have to clamber through a little door in a gate. The place was old, but this is Rome...however the accomodation wasn't up to even 1* standard. Noisy rooms as window shutters rattled, uncomfortable bed and the toilets were cubicle style, imagine having a type of portaloo in your hotel room! The owner/manager seemed pleasant initially but soon proved to be a domineering sort. He would want us back at the hotel by midnight, which is totally unreasonable for any holidaymaker, especially in a large city like Rome. Breakfast was below average, just bread and watery juice. Location is good however, one can walk to Termini station, the Colosseum and the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica is a stone's throw from the hotel. There are also some good value restaurants and bars nearby...Druid's Rock etc

Reviews.Title: “Basic but perfect for base to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rocking_roxy
Reviews.Content: I had read lots of bad reviews about this hotel , but being totally honest it was grand. The only thing that wasnt perfect was most of the staff didnt speak english, only one girl. But we managed !! The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. And the shower was great! The room didnt have a tv.......but what do you need a tv for on holidays?! The breakfast was included and was great . You could have pastys , bread and tea, coffee etc. The hotel was in a perfect spot for exploring, and was aobut 7 mins to termini station where you can get the metro etc. And it is only about 10 mins walk to the colosseum which I thought was fantastic!! I would definetly come bak to that hotel Dont mind the bad reviews, its actually great!

Reviews.Title: “Follow my advice: Don´t go!”
Reviews.Author: Badullivs
Reviews.Content: The only good facts: Has a great ubication, near by the Santa Maria Maggiore church and the bathrooms were new. The rest: one of the worst nights of my life ever! Rome by summer is an oven, and they gave us a small fan that barely blowed the hot air of the room. The small tv has no remote control, and it's in a high ubication. The towels were paper towels, the bed was small, hard and the lingerie was quite old. All that combined eith the noise of the street and the friendly mosquitoes... Next time I'll sleep at the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Exceed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: santimo90
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical of the place after reading all the previous reviews but turns out this was actually a really good hotel for us to stay at. THE BAD: It is true what people say about the towels though, they are just thin strips of cloth that feel like cardboard and yes the beds could've been better but they were good enough and my wife and I had no problems sleeping on it. We had an outside unit and there was traffic it seemed 24/7 but we still managed to get a good night's sleep. THE GOOD: We had a corner unit that looked out into Piazza Esquilino and it was such a beautiful view to wake up to. The breakfast was actually really good, they must've found a better bakery based on what I read from others. Of all the places we stayed in in Italy, this hotel had the best breakfast. The chocolate croissants were outstanding, the OJ and cappucino were great and you also get slices of bread which were really good. The employees were extremely nice and the person checking us out ( I think he was the owner actually) shook hands with us and wished us a wonderful trip and asked if our stay was pleasant. He really cared about how we were taken care of there. Overall a great experiance staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maeve6
Reviews.Content: We like this Hotel Esquilino very much...The location ideal and perfectly situated in the Cental of Rome....and just few blocks from Central Station.Hotel rooms fresh and nice.Staff kind and friendly and very helpful.Thats why we absolutely recomended this hotel. We stay again on next visit! Frank and Molly

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: victorial79
Reviews.Content: This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin but i'ts scraping for 3 stars really. It is very basic. You go in through a big gate in the wall which isn't very clearly marked and walk through a scruffy courtyard to get to the Hotel, which is on the 1st floor of this big building. Our room and en suite bathroom were clean and the bed was comfy enough. The shower head attachment to secure it on to the wall had broken so showering was tricky. The hot water took a long time to kick in too. The towels are a joke, they are like sheets so I would advise you to take your own. The room was cleaned daily thoughso that was a bonus. I had read that there were thieves in the hotel but we never had a problem with this and there was a Safe in the room. Breakfast was basic; a cappuccino or coffee, some orange juice and a criossant each. There were some packet melba toast and jams as well. The location of this hotel was the best part. It was a 5 minute walk to Termini (the main station) and 10-15 minute walk from the Collosseum and Roman Forum etc. We didn't need to use public transport except to get to the Vatican. But there were lots of other 3* hotels in that area which looked much nicer. The nearby restaurants were fine but it was easy enough to walk to other areas anyway. I would say this hotel is good for a basic base but not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Central Location”
Reviews.Author: FRED12327
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome as a part of a secondary school trip from Australia, and we had a large group. For starters we arrived on a public holiday and the entry to the hotel was hard to find and we ended up calling to find out how to get in. No signs were visible to us. We were allowed an early check in to some of our rooms and this was extremely helpful of the staff. Rooms varied and some were much better than others. Staff were not very helpful and spoke little english. And finally breakfast was extremely stingy. However beds were comfortable although one broke while we were there, it was replaced immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a peacefull room”
Reviews.Author: hocko
Reviews.Content: Having read the last posts i was wondering what to expect.Yes the towels were like tae towels no problems as the room was so hot. The air con didnt kick in,the windows were closed to keep the noise out.So we moved to a inside room this was quiter except for pumped water 24hrs.which disturberd my sleep.The spring were coming through but we slept ok.. We alwasy got a seat in the tiny room.The staff were very kind and helpfull and the security was 100%.Location was fine. But take some ear plugs and you will sleep better!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: twokiwis22
Reviews.Content: We attempted to cancel our reservation after checking in 30 minutes before due to several things: 1: The springs could be felt through the beds. 2: the price of the room was way too expensive for the cheap quality: very thin towels, stains on the ceiling and walls. 3: the front desk person called the manager to address our problems. The manager was extremely rude to us over the phone and would not give us a refund. He continued to insult my brother in law for over 10 minutes on the phone. It was like the manager was appalled that we would bring up the idea of asking for a refund or to change rooms. He would not work with us at all. I DO NOT recommend this hotel for the reasons above. Some of the staff were pleasant, otherwise they just overcharged for a horrible room and were insulting to our family. Please to not patronize this hotel and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel was fantasic. The staff was so nice and helped us get around the city much easier. The rooms are small but in home-y way. I loved it, would stay again in a heartbeat. In response to an earlier review about a curfew placed on a party staying there, we just took our key with us the night that we knew we would get back later than there would be an attendent on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Keep Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I returned back to this DUMP and have to say it was awful! Personel doesn't speak english or even italian. They have russians working there that don't speak english or italian. We communicated with our hands! I was robbed in the room! My friends also were robbed! We were three couples all robbed! The director who says he's one of the owners is very rude and offensive. The worst vacation I have ever had and do not reccommend! Keep away! Go sleep in the street but not there! I don't know how something like this is permitted to exist in the center of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: sasha011
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly & informative, however noise was a big problem, was right next to a road so traffic noise 24 hours a day. Because we were staying in a room right near the reception has people talking very loudly and shouting at night! Breakfast room only has 6 small tables and we were told that breakfast was served between 7 - 10, we got down there at 8.00 and all tables were full so we could not get breakfast - very disappointing when you have a full days walking ahead of you! Overall this is very basic, small rooms, with no tea/coffee making facilities in room as was previously advised.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING, Hotel Esquilino-Rome”
Reviews.Author: gail
Reviews.Content: Please do not even consider this hotel. we stayed there in Oct 04. The Porter put a curfew on our party to be back by 00.00hrs ( extended to 01.00 hrs after debate) then once all back on sat and in bed by 01.30 hrs my husband and i woke on Sun morning to find we had been robbed. police officers in our party found no forced entry and no entry to be gained via the window. all property stolen including passports. Hotel staff not prepared to call police. just threw map at us and told us to go to police station ( where Interpreteurs only work mon-fri). On return to Hotel, the staff have already cleaned the rooms) British embassy inform us this is regualr ocurrance. Money required prior to personel to be called out at weekend to enable us to get passports to travel home on sunday ( with no promise of being able to help due to their systems not always working - no money - no help). luckily other members of the party helped us out but would have been stuck on sunday otherwise with no money, food or accomodation. This Hotel is situated within a "secure courtyard" with buzzer entry only - but with porter insisting that we go to bed immediatley and being very aggitated when we continued having a ciggarrette in the corridor - we can only beleive that he is involved within this organised crime of robbing travellers whislt they are asleep in their hotel room. ** please do not stay at this Hotel * ***if you have already booked then take Caution. ****** hide Spare credit card for cash access , photocopy your passport and keep with you at all times ( helps process with replacement at embassy) and block your door at night. Gail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for cheap weekend get away!”
Reviews.Author: Rhona_J
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel by anyones standards, but a perfect match for those cheap last minute flights. Reasonable sized rooms for Rome, simply furnished, and most importantly for anyone, clean! Good base for a sightseeing tour of Rome, we managed to walk everywhere we wanted, and on our homewards trips back each evening, managed to find ourselves on main roads leading direct to the Piazza with the amazing Sant Maria Maggiore within view! We had no trouble with the staff, they even allowed us to leave our baggage aside on the last day to allow us to sightsee without carrying everything. Maybe not the best place if you expect all of homes luxuries, but for a quick get away weekend we would definetly consider returning here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - burglars about”
Reviews.Author: hobbit8602
Reviews.Content: Room good for cheap hotel, breakfast typical continental, staff good, friendly - until - a couple in our party had their room entered while they were asleep. No help from management (except - "you should have shut your window" - even Spiderman couldn't have climbed in!). I suspect an inside job, the night porter was dodgy to say the least. The window opened onto a secure courtyard, no marks on window where the needed ladder would have been. Beware and block your door at night - it cost a day's holiday getting police report (no investigation by them mind) and new passports (expensive).

Reviews.Title: “stayed in worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5th-8th Sept 2003 On the good side, pleasant friendly people running hotel, good location, most places to visit within walking distance. On the bad side, dredful security considering it shares locked (after 10pm) front doors with neighbouring hotel, one of the hotels allowed a theif in through their doors, scaffolding below our window allowed easy access to our room so we were robboed while we slept, hotel owners & police took it in their stride as it seems it is an ongoing problem in Rome so 'sign this please' & go away & sort it when you get home with the insurance company. NO HELP AT ALL! We will go back to Rome one day but will be VERY careful about where we will stay next time!

HotelInfo.Name: Esquilino Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza dell Esquilino 29, 00185 Rome, Italy
